etymology.description: Arrowhead indicating entry -> concept of entering or joining
etymology.interpretation: 入(入) (rù, "enter") depicts an arrowhead pointing inwards, clearly symbolizing entering or penetrating. This helps convey the action or intent to move into something.

examples.chinese: 他走入房间(他走入房間)。
学生入课堂(學生入課堂)，认真学习(認真學習)。
examples.english: Students enter the classroom and study diligently.
